channel.title: Cpu
channel.description:
So i've been out of the loop for way too long. AMD Has actually made a reasonable competitor to the i7 920. I found it while randomly surfing around.
AMD Phenom II X6 1100T 3.3GHz Black Edition
It's a 6-core cpu which is ALMOST as fast as the i7 920. For budget gaming rigs i would highly suggest this piece of good price vs performance. At only 246 USD it really is a bargain.
Discuss.

item.title: Cpu
item.dc:creator: @cumescape cumescape
item.description:
@cumescape wrote:

Wait for Bulldozer if you want to go with AMD.

item.title: Cpu
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

[quote=“zachera, post:11, topic:413280”][quote author=tL link=topic=514781.msg3738362#msg3738362 date=1315099017]
Depends entirely what you’d be using it for…
[/quote]High-end gaming? Crysis 2 (if that’s the current high-spec required game?)?[/quote]
I’ve currently got an AMD Althon II X4 640 3.0ghz processor and I can run any current game on max settings (including cry1 & 2). I’ve also got a GTX460 overclocked by zotac

Read full topic

item.title: Cpu
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

[quote=“zachera, post:11, topic:413280”][quote author=tL link=topic=514781.msg3738362#msg3738362 date=1315099017]
Depends entirely what you’d be using it for…
[/quote]High-end gaming? Crysis 2 (if that’s the current high-spec required game?)?[/quote]

Most CPUs (including the one Speljohan is talking about) are more than capable of running any game out there today. GPUs can do more, and developers are using the GPUs to do more too, games are becoming less CPU intensive all the time.

The only time you’ll see otherwise is when a game has been a near direct port from a console game, because the current generation of consoles have bad GPUs, and much of the power is in the CPUs. Like the PS3 for example, you hear developers talking about how they’ll do a significant portion of the graphics rendering on the CPU before it even hits the GPU.

Read full topic

item.title: Cpu
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“zachera, post:9, topic:413280”]Is the current fastest consumer CPU (whether Intel or AMD) overkill or underkill?[/quote]Unless you’re into realtime video rendering, yes.

item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I think Crysis 1 is more hardware-intensive than Crysis 2, but the highest-end CPU is overkill regardless, a GPU is what you want to invest extra money in for gaming performance.

Read full topic

item.title: Cpu
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

I remember when you last made these claims.

[quote=“tL, post:88, topic:338726”]Even cheaper i5 2500k:

anandtech.com

CPU Benchmarks - Compare Products on AnandTech

CPU benchmarks: Compare two products side-by-side or see a cascading list of product ratings along with our annotations.


http://www.overclockers.co.uk/showproduct.php?prodid=CP-360-IN - i5 2500k (unlocked multipier for better overclocking, so you could get the same CPU for cheaper but is just as quick) £174
http://www.overclockers.co.uk/showproduct.php?prodid=CP-277-AM - AMD Phenom II X6 1100T 3.3GHz Black Edition £152

AMD think by sticking an extra two cores onto their old processor technology will be enough. It clearly isn’t.[/quote]

It says something when Intel’s mid-range quadcore keeps up and does better in a fair few benchmarks than AMDs best consumer processor.

Read full topic

item.title: Cpu
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

AMD has almost always made better CPUs for the money. At least starting with the Athlon XP series, up to when Intel started making the Core2Duo’s, and then from around the Phenom II’s to now. Most of the time if you want the very fastest CPU available, it will be an Intel, but you will pay for it dearly and someone who pays 1/8th of what you did for an AMD one a few months later will have comparable performance.

Read full topic

Sandy Bridge-E will whip it’s arse even more.[/quote]Yer, i’m curious how Bulldozer will hold up.
